samples.text: Review bombing won't work in this climate. It still game me a giggle to fill it out.

Another one. Damn. You online revolutionaries are so cute with your rage and impotence. Yeah. Ignoring genocide and climate collapse. You got me tiger. What happened to you little man? No role models to teach how to think? Is it just blind emotion and hyperbole? Big boy tip for the day. Grow up.
Great initiative. Could really use some of the funny though. Anyone have a link to a standup special or bits that illustrate what genuinely hilarious climate humour looks like?

I stopped using my actual face on my profile after I was doxxed and trolled relentlessly by a Russian troll group with 100 accounts. I support climate activism alright. Don't try and guilt me because I have an AI image of a NAFO character on my profile

It kind of aggravates me when my feed starts being swamped by AI memes of musk, trump or whatever is happening because it's not funny not clever nor activism, it's slop accelerating global warming.

Yes, thats for the nostalgic fans. But today, comics implicate the solution of urging societal and environmental problems we have. They cannot be pure distraction any more, with body building heroes, who use muscles instead of brain. nexusprime democracy nofascism getsmart
Here's a simple 10 minute comic I drew the other day as an art response to the prompt "it's 2050, we've won everything we have been fighting for what does a typical day look like?"

It is incredible, in a year where Disney has bent over backwards to pander to bigots, transphobes and the alt-right, stripping trans characters from their properties and deleting environmental subplots, that Russell T. Davies got Disney money to say, Planet of the Incels.
Exciting mail day! Can't wait to read smart people writing about comics in contexts of environmental and political systems of power mbumatay.bsky.social ohiostatepress.bsky.social

I'm not someone who enjoys being negative, but with the political climate in play at the moment it can be hard to be anything else! Perhaps I'll have to change mine as well, because I share your views on most stuff
A national election in 2025 without a conversation on climate change is an absolute joke. cdnpoli

I am so saddened that the escalating climate catastrophe, which every day, leads me to be increasingly terrified for my children, was presented as an amusing' aside the presenters laughed their way through it.
It's even funnier - the fastest way to solve the global warming!

A bit like the cartoon with the climatic wasteland and the guy saying but for a while, some people got great return on investment’ so with this. Yea it’s Gilead. But for a while, I got great social media engagement. Little thumbs up icons. It activated my dopamine receptors. Ask your parents.
I bit get the nervous laughter meme and big does it track in today’s climate.

Woke up laughing about a J Haidt wannabe who was bragging pre 7 November 24 that his 'study' showed that young Republicans cared about the climate crisis and that the top Magaist was taking this into account.

If you thought the rightwing White House "press" corps were a bunch of ass-kissing toadies, watch Bill Maher's monologue sometime. The audience over-laughs at every joke like they're simultaneously sucking nitrous oxide and smoking weed. EVERY "punchline" gets an applause break. It's embarrassing.
Glad it made you laugh! In today’s political climate laughter helps!

Happy Sunday BlueSkyFriends! Laughter can be a powerful tool for change. Comedians are bringing climate conversations to the stage, using humor to inspire awareness and action for our planet’s future. ClimateAction EcoComedy apnews.comarticlecome...
Funny, and yet - given the current climate - not funny. Had to doublecheck that this was, in fact, an Onion article.

It doesn't matter what I interpret the sentence to mean. In this political climate sarcasm and attempts to be clever while peddling dangerous ideas is...dangerous. I can see your attempt at funny, and I'm letting you know this is not a joke.

every time I sit to scroll during my breaks I swear. you all are grown adults with the capacity to think and consider the climate of your social environments before you type shit out. fucking act like it.
There's nothing more cringe than pigeonholing yourself according to some moldy biohazardous terf's crappy world building. Jobless behavior...
